intro: Currania oyamensis var. gracilipes, commonly known as the slender currania, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender stems, opposite leaves, and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
